http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Affordances are the all type of properties that are belong to devices and it show the possible actions users can take with it.
Human body. A collection of body parts.
Parts of human body.
In here, device means a piece of hardware or software which consists with sensors or actuators or both.

Duration is a temporal extent. 
In this ontology, duration is used to measure a certain body part movement.
A finger is a (body) part of the human body and a type of digit.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: thumb, middle finger, left ring finger etc

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The forearm is the line between the elbow joint and the wrist
Gestures (movements) made with forearm
In this ontology, a gesturre is defined as a movement or a pose of the fingers and/or palm and/or upper arm and/or forearm.
Gestures (movements) made with fingers and palms
Second finger or the second digit of hand

Left hand palm
Left hand ring finger
Thumb of left hand
Left upper arm
Fifth finger or the fifth digit of hand
The coordinate system that’s convenient for a given entity(Finger, palm etc.) is called the local coordinate system, local space, or object space.
Manufacturing company of a device
Third finger or the third digit of hand
An act of moving. In this onlogy it is an act of moving a certain body part towrds a certain direction.
The area located at the end of the forearm (starting from wrist) up until the start of a finger which is the central region of the anterior part of the hand.
Movement of palm. Either right or left.
Position of a pose in a particular time

The quaternion itself is defined as q = w + xi + yj + zk where w, x, y, and z are real numbers and i is defined as square root of -1. With quaternions, i = j = k = square root of -1.

The magnitude of a quaternion is calculated by magnitude = square root of (w2 + x2 + y2 + z2). For the unit quaternions, the magnitude is one.

Right hand palm
Right hand ring finger
Thumb of right hand
Right upper arm
Fourth finger or the fourth digit of hand
Rotation of a pose
First digit of hand
Defines units of measurement for position and rotation
The upper arm is the line between the shoulder and elbow joint.
Gestures (movements) made with upper arm

In an equation where quaternion (q) = w + xi + yj + zk, where w, x, y, and z are all real numbers and i-component = x 

In the euqation 'i' is defined as sqrt(-1). With quaternions, i = j = k = sqrt(-1).

In an equation where quaternion (q) = w + xi + yj + zk, where w, x, y, and z are all real numbers j-component = y 

In the euqation 'i' is defined as sqrt(-1). With quaternions, i = j = k = sqrt(-1).

In an equation where quaternion (q) = w + xi + yj + zk, where w, x, y, and z are all real numbers k-component = z 

In the euqation 'i' is defined as sqrt(-1). With quaternions, i = j = k = sqrt(-1).

Frame of reference or the initial center. 
Location of the (0,0,0) postion related to the given coordinates.
Represents the amount of rotation which will occur about this axis defined by (i-component, j-component, k-component). Known as scalar component.
